channel.title: CNN.com - Business

image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Where are world's piracy hotspots?
item.ExtractedText: October 31, 2013 -- Updated 1159 GMT (1959 HKT) Where are the world's most dangerous waters? Hint; they're not off the coast of Somalia. Most spectacular train stations October 17, 2013 -- Updated 1122 GMT (1922 HKT) Train and metro stations have become unlikely havens for some of the most exquisite architecture and design. We profile some of the best. Ducks overboard! October 9, 2013 -- Updated 1239 GMT (2039 HKT) What have 29,000 plastic toys that fell overboard a cargo ship in 1992 been doing for the last 21 years? October 2, 2013 -- Updated 1155 GMT (1955 HKT) CNN's Andrew Stevens looks at Hong Kong International's new midfield terminal and a potential third runway. October 4, 2013 -- Updated 1340 GMT (2140 HKT) How are ports adapting to cope with the new generation of giant cargo ships? Where is the world's busiest airport? September 27, 2013 -- Updated 1152 GMT (1952 HKT) London, Beijing or somewhere in the United States: Where is the world's busiest airport? Find out in our detailed infographic. Meet the midnight 'tunnel moles' September 20, 2013 -- Updated 1352 GMT (2152 HKT) It's approaching midnight, and a team of eager "tunnel moles" stands poised to carry out maintenance on the world's longest undersea structure. September 13, 2013 -- Updated 0927 GMT (1727 HKT) Urban gondolas are offering cheap and effective methods of mass-transportation in some of South America's biggest cities. Sailing world's busiest shipping lane September 5, 2013 -- Updated 1135 GMT (1935 HKT) How do you squeeze 500 ships through a straight of water just 21 miles wide in a single day? Find out as The Gateway visits the English Channel. Linking Europe and Asia by rail June 27, 2013 -- Updated 0923 GMT (1723 HKT) The Silk Road was once a series of dusty trails forged by traders traveling between Asia and Europe. Today it takes the form of a bustling railway. Introducing the world's biggest ship June 26, 2013 -- Updated 1249 GMT (2049 HKT) An all new class of container ship, the Triple E is a quarter-of-a-mile long and built from enough steel to construct 8 Eiffel Towers. 8 spectacular infrastructure projects June 18, 2013 -- Updated 1136 GMT (1936 HKT) Take a peek at some of the most exciting travel infrastructure projects currently in the works around the world. Could drones be future highways? May 31, 2013 -- Updated 1734 GMT (0134 HKT) Two ambitious tech start-ups are aiming to create a network of automated drones that will help connect rural and under-developed areas.
